game_manager_for_cli module¶

class game_manager_for_cli.GameManagerForCLI¶

Bases : object

A class used to manage the progress of a complete game in CLI mode. The CLI messages are not created and displayed here.

is_over¶
Type

a bool set to True when the game is finished (a player has no tiles anymore or no other tile can be played)

current_player¶
Type

an int set to 0 when the human plays and to 1 when the computer plays.

number_of_players¶
Type

an int constant equal to 2 (human vs computer)

players¶
Type

list of Player objects

board¶
Type

Board object containing the current state of the board

deck¶
Type

Deck object: the set of tiles used in the game

with_draw¶
Type

a bool constant set to False: play without draw.

end_game()¶

Ends a game by computing and displaying the winner. Requests if the player wants to start a new game.

Renvoie

  • None if the players doesn’t want to play a new game.

  • A Game object if the player wants to play one more game.

first_player_to_play()¶

Determines the first player to play. In this version, the Human player always begins.

Renvoie

Type renvoyé

None

game_is_over()¶

Checks if a game is over.

Renvoie

Type renvoyé

A bool

init_ai()¶

Set the players played by the computer.

Renvoie

Type renvoyé

None

init_board()¶

Initializes the board.

Renvoie

Type renvoyé

None

init_deck()¶

Initialises the deck by adding tiles and shuffling it.

Renvoie

Type renvoyé

None

init_game()¶

Initializes the game (deck, players, board, which is first to play)

Renvoie

Type renvoyé

None

init_mode()¶

Initialize the game mode

init_players()¶

Creates the players (human and computer) and creates their hand, fills them with tiles. The Computer players are always placed after the human players.

Renvoie

Type renvoyé

None

init_with_draw()¶

Choose to play with a draw or not.

Renvoie

Type renvoyé

None

play()¶

Plays one turn (for human or AI player)

Renvoie

Type renvoyé

None

player_who_has_tile_in_hand(tile)¶

Finds if a player has a particular Tile (passed as paramater) :param tile: :type tile: a Tile objects which is equal (==) to the seeked tile

Renvoie

Type renvoyé

A Player object (from the players list) if one of the players has the tile passed as parameter in hand, None otherwise.

start_game()¶

Makes the current game continue between each move. Checks if the game is completed.

Renvoie

Type renvoyé

None

update_game_state(tile, side)¶

Update the state of the game by placing the played tile on the board and removing it from the player’s hand, checking if the game is over.

Paramètres

  • tile (the Tile object to be played) –

  • side (a string "left" or "right") –

  • player (a Player object: the player who plays.) –

Renvoie

Type renvoyé

None
